alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Hocking; Licking; Pickaway; Pike; Ross (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 4:55PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF FAIRFIELD, HOCKING, EASTERN PICKAWAY, NORTHEASTERN PIKE, SOUTHERN LICKING AND EASTERN ROSS COUNTIES THROUGH 530 PM EDT... At 455 PM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Millersport to 6 miles northwest of Waverly, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Lancaster, Chillicothe, Pickerington, Circleville, Heath, Logan, Waverly, Pataskala, Canal Winchester, Nelsonville, Baltimore, Buckeye Lake, Hebron, Bremen, Millersport, Kingston, Pleasantville, Hide-A-Way Hills, Fairfield Beach and Logan Elm Village. This includes I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 118 and 142, and near mile marker 144. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If these storms become stronger, then a warning may be needed. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for central and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
